title: How to Change Your iCloud Email (Apple ID) on iPhone, iPad, & Desktop

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone or iPad. Look for the settings cog icon on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap your name.
steps.content: Tap your name. It's the section at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Sign-In & Security.
steps.content: Tap Sign-In & Security . It's near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Edit next to "Email & Phone Number."
steps.content: Tap Edit next to "Email & Phone Number." This small blue link is just above your current iCloud email address.

steps.title: Tap the red remove button next to your email address .
steps.content: Tap the red remove button next to your email address . A red "Delete" button will appear. If you don't want to change your iCloud email address entirely but want to add a second email to your account (which can make it easier for friends and family to find you on FaceTime , Messages , and other Apple services), don't tap the remove buttonâ€”instead, tap Add Email or Phone Number > Add an Email Address , and enter a new email address. You'll then receive a confirmation code at your new email address that you'll need to enter to complete the action.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . A pop-up will appear, instructing you to choose another email address.

steps.title: Tap Choose Another Email.
steps.content: Tap Choose Another Email . If prompted, enter your passcode to continue. You can't add an email address that is already associated with another Apple ID. You will not be able to change your iCloud email address to a new iCloud address you've created within the last 30 days. If you just created a new iCloud email address , wait 30 days before adding it to your Apple ID. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enter your new email address and tap Continue.
steps.content: Enter your new email address and tap Continue . A verification code will be sent to your new email address to confirm.

steps.title: Enter the verification code to complete the change.
steps.content: Enter the verification code to complete the change. You'll find the code in the email from Apple. If you are changing the email to one that you already listed as a secondary contact email (seen under "Reachable At"), you will not need to verify it, as you already verified the email when adding it.

steps.title: Go to https://appleid.apple.com/ in a web browser and sign in.
steps.content: Go to https://appleid.apple.com/ in a web browser and sign in. Use the email address (or phone number) and password you use to log in to iCloud . If you have a trusted device connected to your Apple ID (such as an iPhone or iPad), the website will redirect you to complete the process on that device. If you haven't added a trusted device, you'll be able to continue changing your email address on the website.

steps.title: Click Email & Phone Numbers.
steps.content: Click Email & Phone Numbers . You'll see it under "Sign-In and Security."

steps.title: Click the minus sign (-) next to your current email address.
steps.content: Click the minus sign (-) next to your current email address. A pop-up will appear, asking you to enter a new Apple ID. If you don't want to change your iCloud email address, you can keep the existing one in place and instead click the Add + button to add another address. Just make sure not to use an address that's already associated with an Apple ID.

steps.title: Enter your new email address and click Change Apple ID.
steps.content: Enter your new email address and click Change Apple ID . This sends a verification code to the new email address. You can't add an email address that is already associated with another Apple ID. You will not be able to change your iCloud email address to a new iCloud address you've created within the last 30 days. If you just made a new iCloud email address, wait 30 days before adding it to your Apple ID.

steps.title: Enter the verification code to complete the change.
steps.content: Enter the verification code to complete the change. Open the inbox belonging to your new email and look for a verification email from Apple. Follow the instructions to verify your email and finish changing your iCloud email address.
